abstract_summ: The incidence of hiatal hernia after esophagectomy for carcinoma has been reported to only be between 0.6 and 10% . The authors present the first literature case report of laparoscopic multivisceral resection for gastrocolic fistula secondary to locally advanced colon cancer . Laparoscopic and endoscopic cooperative surgery (LECS) reportedly helps achieve favorable postoperative outcomes .
